comments: In the current EPF ClearCase integration, CC Dynamic view has not been supported. This RFE requires EPF to make sure CC dynamic view can used with the EPF for nromal CM usage.

After a lot of testing, CC dynamic view integration in RMC is basically working. But there are two issues found: 1. filed as bug 165435 2. RMC will hang sometime under CC7.0 and CC SCM 6.0.49 environemnt. 

This bug is intended for the #2 issue above.

Here are some more issues in using CC Dynamic view with RMC:

1. Delete an element which already checked in, tools prompt me should check out first before delete, after answer "Yes", I got "java.lang.reflect.InvocationtargetException", element will not be deleted
   - the workaround is delete it after checked out

2. Create the first configuration of library under source control, answer "OK" to add the configuration to source control, tools prompt me "The name $Configuration_name already exists". Then tow configurations (same name) are shown in Library view.
   - the workaround is delete the one which without the "checked out" icon

3. Import a library configuration to current library which have the same element name, tools prompt a error while rename the existed element (no matter this element is checked out or not), then two same names are shown in Library view, they are "$Originalname_renamed"
   - User have to insure there are no conflict element name before import

another scenario from Jiang Xuan:

I tried delete element after I do a "Find check out" and check in all elements, I got the following message while RMC check out plugin.xmi before delete element in it.

I could not reproduce any of the problems reported.
Jiang Xuan, can you consistently reproduce these problems? What version of CC SCM adapter you are using? This might be data related problems. Could you please send me the library that you see the reported problem with.

Created an attachment (id=55088)
Error message while create the first configuration

For problem:
2) Create the first configuration of library under source control, answer "OK"
to add the configuration to source control, tools prompt me "The name
$Configuration_name already exists". Then tow configurations (same name) are
shown in Library view.
   - the workaround is delete the one which without the "checked out" icon
Details Steps:
1. Create a new dynamic view with CC tools, e.g., d_view on U:
2. Create a new library on it
3. Create new configuration by content menu
4. Input configuration name, click OK
5. Tools prompt add XMI file to source control, click OK (2 configurations are shown in library view, see image)
6. IUPL0101E error popup, says "the name already exists"

Hi Phong, I don't think these problems are data releated, I can reproduce them on my "clean" environment while I create a new library.

You know, I'm not familiar on CC, if you cannot reproduce these problems, maybe I missed the key steps, pls see the error image of problem 1.

All these issues are related to the resource reloading in the middle of delete/create/import operation. I have fixed this by deferring the broadcasting resource change notifications until the operation is finished.

Here are the verify result on EPF 1.0.2-1213-1400 build

#1 and #3 are fixed, verified on CC Baltic server and dynamic view
#2 still occurs on the EPF 1.0.2 build, please see my steps:
1. Create a new library out of dynamic view, e.g., C:\TestLibrary
2. Open Navigator view, share this library, move this library to a dynamic view
3. Answer Yes while CC prompt add files to source control
4. Create a new configuration
   --> Two configurationsare created with the same name and you will got a error message from EPF
Remark: I can create configuration without error if I create new library in dynamic view directly
Need to further investigate the one remaining issue.

More investigate on problem #2, the root cause is case sensitive problem on Dynamic view, and I think it should be a major one.

To reproduce it, change step4 in Comment #8:
4. Create a new configuration named "Test" (cannot reproduce this problem while named with 'test')

I would like re-summary this defect as following:
1. Create a new library under a dynamic view -->Prompt add library.xmi to source control
2. Create a new plug-in -->Prompt check out library.xmi and add plugin.xmi to source control
3. Create a new Role, change the default name to 'TestRole' -->Prompt check out plugin.xmi
4. Input some chars in main description of Role, save it -->Prompt add 'testrole.xmi' to source control, note it isn't 'TestRole.xmi'

Problems:
1. Right click on the role node in library view, the 'Show in resource navigator' doesn't work
2. The CM icon in library view isn't indicate this element is under source control
3. Try to modify this element, will got an error says this element cannot be check out

Remarks:
1. No such problem on Snapshot view
2. No such problem while create new element with lower case chars

Workaround:
Create 'testrole' first, then rename element to 'TestRole' by content menu from library view
Could not reproduce issues described in comment #8 and #10. New files are created and added to CC with correct cases.

Created an attachment (id=56252)
ClearCase settings

Hi Phong,

Please see the attached image, the 'Case Preserving' is unchecked in Control Panel->ClearCase on my environment, so the ClearCase filter the case sensitive in this case. After check it, RMC works fine while integrate with ClearCase, it isn't a RMC problem. Thanks.
ClearCase dynamic view must be configured to preserve case sensitivity as described in comment #10.
Fix is verified on build EPF 1.0.2 20070108 after configured to preserve case sensitivity of ClearCase Server.
